definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Jest with an ass and he will flap you in the face with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 你跟驢子開玩笑，將被驢尾打耳光。

sentences.english: Chen Jiaying is Laojiang Hu that she would take hasty to Faye Wong in the stomach joke?
sentences.chinese: 陳家瑛是老江湖，她會草率到拿王菲的肚子開玩笑嗎？

sentences.english: LL: I really was just kidding, Li Hua. You're not a big baby.
sentences.chinese: 你惹急了我就說是開玩笑。

sentences.english: We drank cheap Shancheng Beer, we joked around, we took turns singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 我們喝了廉價的山城啤酒，我們開玩笑，輪流唱歌。

sentences.english: Tom—honest injun, now—is it fun, or earnest?
sentences.chinese: 湯姆，你是開玩笑，還是說真格的？

sentences.english: His father laughs and says the boy jumped six and nine-tenths inches.
sentences.chinese: 他父親開玩笑說小男孩跳了六寸多高。

sentences.english: The old lags used to joke on the convict boats.
sentences.chinese: 多次坐牢的慣犯過去常在囚船上開玩笑。

sentences.english: I hope you're lying for the sake of titillation .
sentences.chinese: 我希望你是隨便開玩笑的意思。

sentences.english: She is always ragging Tom about his stammer.
sentences.chinese: 她總是拿湯姆的口喫開玩笑。

sentences.english: We often chaff him for his fear of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常拿他的怕老婆開玩笑。

sentences.english: AAre you kidding? Don't you see many people over there? Just on your right.
sentences.chinese: 你開玩笑吧？你沒看見那裏有很多人嗎？就在你右邊。

sentences.english: Laughing and joking are improper at a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 葬禮時大笑和開玩笑是不合適的。

sentences.english: The men started to jest about it, talk to each other, and share the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 人們開始拿這事開玩笑，互相嘮着並分享自己的報紙。

sentences.english: "I know a few good-looking broads, " Johnny said jokingly .
sentences.chinese: “我認識幾個漂亮女人，”約翰暱開玩笑他說。

sentences.english: Joking aside I want to reassure you that I am invited here tonight.
sentences.chinese: 拋開玩笑，我襄蜇申今晚我的確是受邀而來的。

definition: to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to ridicule/to tease/to mock/idle talk/chitchat
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
actually/in fact/really
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
it doesn't matter
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
that kind/that sort
same/like/equal to/the same as/just like
just now/a moment ago
to press charges/to file a complaint
to tell/to inform/to let know
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
